results.title: Current evidence on drug therapy for dementia in people with Down syndrome: an overview of systematic reviews.
results.text_hl: Results: Five SRs were included, analyzing the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, antioxidants, @CHEMICAL_Acetylcarnitine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000108 @@@acetyl-L-carnitine@@@, anticonvulsants, acetylcholinesterase inhibitors (@CHEMICAL_Donepezil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077265 @@@donepezil@@@), NMDA receptor antagonists (@CHEMICAL_Memantine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008559 @@@memantine@@@), and fast-acting intranasal @CHEMICAL_Insulin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007328 @@@insulin@@@ on @DISEASE_Dementia @DISEASE_MESH:D003704 @@@dementia@@@ symptoms in @<m>DISEASE_Down_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004314 @@@DS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: do Nascimento TG, do Nascimento ACL, Campos MA, Fernandes RAML. Current evidence on drug therapy for dementia in people with Down syndrome: an overview of systematic reviews. Dement Neuropsychol. 2025;19():e20240241. PMID: 40860508
citations.BibTeX: @article{40860508, title={Current evidence on drug therapy for dementia in people with Down syndrome: an overview of systematic reviews.}, author={do Nascimento TG and do Nascimento ACL and Campos MA and Fernandes RAML}, journal={Dement Neuropsychol}, volume={19}, pages={e20240241}}

results.title: Towards onset prevention of cognition decline in adults with Down syndrome (The TOP-COG study): A pilot randomised controlled trial
results.text_hl: Acquire data to design a full-scale, multi-centre RCT of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for the primary prevention of @DISEASE_Dementia @DISEASE_MESH:D003704 @@@dementia@@@ in @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer disease@@@ in older adults with @<m>DISEASE_Down_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004314 @@@Down syndrome@@@

citations.NLM: Cooper SA, Ademola T, Caslake M, Douglas E, Evans J, Greenlaw N, Haig C, Hassiotis A, Jahoda A, McConnachie A, Morrison J, Ring H, Starr J, Stiles C, Sirisena C, Sullivan F. Towards onset prevention of cognition decline in adults with Down syndrome (The TOP-COG study): A pilot randomised controlled trial Trials. 2016 Jul 29;17():370. PMID: 27473843
citations.BibTeX: @article{27473843, title={Towards onset prevention of cognition decline in adults with Down syndrome (The TOP-COG study): A pilot randomised controlled trial}, author={Cooper SA and Ademola T and Caslake M and Douglas E and Evans J and Greenlaw N and Haig C and Hassiotis A and Jahoda A and McConnachie A and Morrison J and Ring H and Starr J and Stiles C and Sirisena C and Sullivan F}, journal={Trials}, volume={17}, pages={370}}

results.title: Not all statins are alike: induced rhabdomyolysis on changing from one statin to another one.
results.text_hl: After switching from @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, she developed severe @DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@muscular weakness@@@ and laboratory evidence of @<m>DISEASE_Down_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004314 @@@muscle break down@@@.

citations.NLM: Sochman J, Podzimkova M. Not all statins are alike: induced rhabdomyolysis on changing from one statin to another one. Int J Cardiol. 2005 Mar 10;99(1):145-6. PMID: 15721517
citations.BibTeX: @article{15721517, title={Not all statins are alike: induced rhabdomyolysis on changing from one statin to another one.}, author={Sochman J and Podzimkova M}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={99}, number={1}, pages={145-6}}

results.title: Toward onset prevention of cognitive decline in adults with Down syndrome (the TOP-COG study): study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
results.text_hl: The measures described below will be used with the adults with @<m>DISEASE_Down_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004314 @@@Down syndrome@@@ at baseline and after 12 months of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or placebo treatment to determine the effect size by comparing the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group with the placebo group.

citations.NLM: Cooper SA, Caslake M, Evans J, Hassiotis A, Jahoda A, McConnachie A, Morrison J, Ring H, Starr J, Stiles C, Sullivan F. Toward onset prevention of cognitive decline in adults with Down syndrome (the TOP-COG study): study protocol for a randomized controlled trial Trials. 2014 Jun 3;15():202. PMID: 24888381
